resources.string: The numbers below are the emergency hotlines assign to this state. In the event of an emergency occuring in your environment kindly dial one of the numbers provided. Please ensure these numbers are dialed only when there is the need to. The general hotline number is responsibility for all cases of the COVID-19 virus in the country. Isolate yourself and stay safe.
Click below to call NCDC Toll free line
Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water.
Maintain at least 1 metre (3 feet) distance between yourself and anyone who is coughing or sneezing.
Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth
Hands touch many surfaces and can pick up viruses. Once contaminated, hands can transfer the virus to your eyes, nose or mouth
Make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze.
Select yes if you are coughing more than usual.
Select yes if your body temperature is above 37ËšC.
Select yes if you feel tired or lack energy.
Select yes if you are experiencing body ache.
Select yes if you are experiencing frequent watery stool.
Select yes if you have difficulty breathing.
You have not taken the test
You could be undergoing stress, rest and observe proper health hygiene.
You have mild symptomps. rest,keep warm, take plenty of water and take hot showers to help with the sore throat.
Your case is Severe, please call the NCDC hotline in your state
\"Please take the test to confirm your current health status"
You seem to be fine, exercise, eat fruits, observe the prevention techniques and stay healthy
